title: ICE: generic RPIT with implicit HRTB when missing dyn

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code Found originally via https://discord.com/channels/273534239310479360/273541522815713281/1014981030022750328 I managed to reduce it to ```rust fn ice() -> impl AsRef { todo!() } ``` [playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=66591852861d8334fe46a9f3cb9417df) This seems to be related to a combination of RPIT, missing `dyn` keyword, implicit HRTB (`&()`) and parenthesis syntax for the inner trait ### Meta ICEs on both current beta (1.64) and latest nightly (1.65), but **not** on stable (1.63) `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0-nightly (bc4b39c27 2022-08-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: bc4b39c271bbd36736cbf1c0a1ac23d5df38d365 commit-date: 2022-08-29 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.65.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no entry for node id: `NodeId(49)`', compiler\rustc_ast_lowering\src\lib.rs:526:55 error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.65.0-nightly (bc4b39c27 2022-08-29) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden ```
Backtrace
